newsitem.title: NORWAY: No bomb found onboard threatened Norway ferry.
newsitem.headline: No bomb found onboard threatened Norway ferry.

text.p: A ferry carrying 950 passengers broke off a journey to Denmark and returned to Oslo on Sunday after an anonymous bomb threat, police said.
But no explosives were found on board the Stena Saga ferry after an all-day search with sniffer dogs, a police spokesman said.
"We have no idea who made the threat," he told Reuters. "The ship will leave port again tonight."
Passengers were billeted in hotels or returned to their homes while the search went on.
The ferry, owned by Swedish ferry company Stena Line, had left Oslo for Fredrikshavn on Saturday night when an anonymous telephone caller said a bomb had been placed on board.
A spokesman for Stena Line said it was the first time the company had received a bomb threat.
